elements.2211.03074_d0112275172277cedc248476f856a: Influence Maximization (IM) is a classical combinatorial optimization problem, which can be widely used in mobile networks, social computing, and recommendation systems
elements.2211.03074_171504aca3583e730bbb40a9e6f11: It aims at selecting a small number of users such that maximizing the influence spread across the online social network
elements.2211.03074_f7f2baac35c673ff873a81ba12357: Because of its potential commercial and academic value, there are a lot of researchers focusing on studying the IM problem from different perspectives
elements.2211.03074_de0d646b4b3c5313d41fb0f712af2: The main challenge comes from the NP-hardness of the IM problem and
elements.2211.03074_b184092b299456ef046b78314e1b5: P-hardness of estimating the influence spread, thus traditional algorithms for overcoming them can be categorized into two classes: heuristic algorithms and approximation algorithms
elements.2211.03074_c456cdb1734feb156427dbeb78705: However, there is no theoretical guarantee for heuristic algorithms, and the theoretical design is close to the limit
elements.2211.03074_55023eb6bb98574df7b5969752106: Therefore, it is almost impossible to further optimize and improve their performance
elements.2211.03074_0ebc6975f8d2a2497bac2255dbcb9: With the rapid development of artificial intelligence, the technology based on Machine Learning (ML) has achieved remarkable achievements in many fields
elements.2211.03074_dde21af8507d6795700b0857fe326: In view of this, in recent years, a number of new methods have emerged to solve combinatorial optimization problems by using ML-based techniques
elements.2211.03074_63d23d2d5d0426b0d5020f84d110b: These methods have the advantages of fast solving speed and strong generalization ability to unknown graphs, which provide a brand-new direction for solving combinatorial optimization problems
elements.2211.03074_314c07b55d5b10fa7e74088ac59c1: Therefore, we abandon the traditional algorithms based on iterative search and review the recent development of ML-based methods, especially Deep Reinforcement Learning, to solve the IM problem and other variants in social networks
elements.2211.03074_e97e287b18bcba154d54f960bd842: We focus on summarizing the relevant background knowledge, basic principles, common methods, and applied research
elements.2211.03074_43955c2435896fd56544644ab302e: Finally, the challenges that need to be solved urgently in future IM research are pointed out.
elements.2211.03074_a7daa80b865114dd23ce9b23b970d: Design and analysis of algorithms</concept_desc> <concept_significance>500</concept_significance> </concept> </ccs2012> <ccs2012> <concept> <concept_id>10010147.10010257.10010293</concept_id> <concept_desc>Computing methodologies
elements.2211.03074_7c5a36c4f59e7c69be7dfa177ff26: With the rapid development of the mobile internet, social media platforms and content sharing platforms are rapidly emerging
elements.2211.03074_915252ccea0c472c07243194722e3: Compared with newspapers, radio, television, and other traditional media, mobile Internet-based media has faster speed, lower cost, and more diverse forms
elements.2211.03074_8d925432c1fe9ed091dc753e2a494: Thus, the commercial social giants represented by Weibo, Facebook, TikTok, and Twitter were quickly born and strengthened in the last two decades
elements.2211.03074_b37ebe8b6eaa2da238f7a3e70e855: All these applications are based on the Online Social Network (OSN), which is a structure composed of individuals and social interactions between them
elements.2211.03074_b3f0672fe323b2164928e2ab8f76f: It acts as a medium for spreading information, ideas or opinions among users through the effect of
elements.2211.03074_ee1993b3e6aff62a10f64759f03bf: For example, Facebook has over 1.52 billion daily active users and Twitter has 321 million monthly active users
elements.2211.03074_55f03caf52f8219ff86cc5751129e: The phenomenon of information diffusion in social networks has attracted the attention of scholars, businessmen and politicians because of its huge value in many aspects
elements.2211.03074_c5541d7609851a3b69807eea78154: These values can be used in many specific applications, such as virus marketing
elements.2211.03074_8d6a6fa8fe9d8cbca73f7e6ed65a7: As a result, they jointly promote research on the Influence Maximization (IM) problem
elements.2211.03074_5456d9fd6fe2ede3d0e6040b6ca5e: The IM problem is the most important algorithmic problem in the research of information diffusion in social networks, which has been extensively studied for twenty years
elements.2211.03074_75e7b4e860cdefcdb82424b6f7540: formally defined the IM problem as a combinatorial optimization problem in 2003, which aims to select a size-
elements.2211.03074_ae7b439bd1222b7aa58faf51b8d76: seed set such that the expected number of activated users (influence spread) can be maximized given a diffusion model such as Independent Cascade (IC) model and Linear Threshold (LT) model
elements.2211.03074_206bc5e2f819cca4621084008a15b: This problem persists because of its inherent complexity
elements.2211.03074_1f272bfc69eb4830bd34abf0e6cae: First, it has been proven that the IM problem is NP-hard
elements.2211.03074_97dfc98e39f48efa7a7c5082bd5a0: , thus there is no exact solution within polynomial running time
elements.2211.03074_d91102e5893c58827e6c9ac844d85: Second, due to the stochasticity of information diffusion process, it is
elements.2211.03074_a64782ab4c2b60d8ff4e2d2ae9c85: P-hard to accurately compute the influence spread given a seed set under the commonly used diffusion models
elements.2211.03074_cf36091cd77f70f56cac3b402c6c3: Third, the IM problem depends on the given diffusion model and its corresponding parameters, but it is difficult to get it in practical applications
elements.2211.03074_49e596e325c175c8623c47a9f3db8: They have hindered the application of IM algorithms in large-scale social scenarios together
elements.2211.03074_a53c925a4cf67b4cdbe13e67dc8b4: In the last two decades, the above three challenges have motivated a great deal of research to develop efficient algorithms for the IM problem
elements.2211.03074_0d6a489ba28f58e9ea0ed9eded1f7: The existing work is mainly devoted to studying how to estimate the influence spread for the IM problem, and using the design techniques of heuristic algorithms or approximate algorithms to seek a balance between effectiveness, efficiency, and generalization ability
elements.2211.03074_1d62fe5e8c1024473a88a9a478122: In this paper, heuristic algorithms and approximate algorithms are collectively referred to as
elements.2211.03074_9731377c985beb2ff4d8f0d37e695: The heuristic algorithm is efficient and works well in some cases, but it has to be designed for a specific diffusion model, which is not universal, and there is no theoretical guarantee of the worst case
elements.2211.03074_ca198e86c52e80d729a8b4b705787: The time complexity of approximation algorithm cannot be further reduced on the premise of taking approximation into account, and it is difficult to meet the demand for algorithm performance due to the growing network scale
elements.2211.03074_521bdfe3dbcbc46bbeee524764d0c: In addition, traditional algorithms do not have good generalization ability
elements.2211.03074_0f162a8552688d6f099ee73457a39: In practical applications, frequent users' access leads to dynamic changes in social networks
elements.2211.03074_ddb0077a6803074c9a7a98a384ec5: When the network changes greatly, the traditional algorithm generally needs to search and solve again, or adjust the heuristic rules through trial and error to achieve better results
elements.2211.03074_13dd86c8401c7338962844e7fba6b: Therefore, these traditional methods have high computational cost and are difficult to be extended to large-scale, online, and real-time optimization problems, especially for variant IM problems
elements.2211.03074_d6232ea792ca0735029d921534c4c: With the development of artificial intelligence technology, the method based on Machine Learning (ML) has surpassed traditional methods and achieved remarkable success in many fields
elements.2211.03074_dfb59494a08e6e70ee91740f23011: , as an important branch of ML, achieves function approximation through Deep Neural Networks (DNNs), showing amazing learning and decision-making ability
elements.2211.03074_344f1effe0e05754d67b6f3733f73: It chooses an action according to the current state, and adjusts its own strategy according to the return brought by the action, which is called sequential decision-making
elements.2211.03074_a86396dfba137571c6caf7a95e8f1: Based on that, there are several studies that recently begin to use DRL to learn a generalized policy for a certain combinatorial optimization problems on graphs
elements.2211.03074_91266aced08fd6c05b77d9b915e90: The IM problem is a typical combinatorial optimization problem, that is, the optimal choice of decision variables in discrete space is naturally coupled with the action choice of reinforcement learning (RL)
elements.2211.03074_d53b3f8d183850537c1db4ed2c997: DRL has the characteristics of "offline training and online decision-making", which makes it possible to solve combinatorial optimization problems in online real-time manners
elements.2211.03074_f6252ff5acd3d7fe2a8334029a2c8: Therefore, we can see that it is a feasible direction to use ML-based methods to solve the IM problem in social networks, so as to overcome the bottleneck of traditional algorithms
elements.2211.03074_7e24b143aad8b712f4c08be66660f: In this paper, we aim to make a comprehensive overview on the IM problem from an ML-based combinatorial optimization perspective
elements.2211.03074_37eaec023dca710301d369438b6fe: Here, we will focus on the following three aspects for detailed display.
elements.2211.03074_5e7f8ecf23e09ca88f1c7f97c7b44: We first review the basic diffusion models, the definition of the IM problem, its properties, and computational complexity
elements.2211.03074_86d24b236bb40b69b7bb131c5a9bb: Then, we introduce the classical greedy algorithm to study the IM problem, and review traditional algorithms, heuristic and approximation algorithms, according to the taxonomy of existing IM algorithms
elements.2211.03074_4d672d59441e616724c5f5baab98f: , including simulation-based, proxy-based, and sampling-based approaches
elements.2211.03074_5743a85f9595222c91a8c35dd04d4: At last, we summarize the design bottlenecks and shortcomings of traditional algorithms, and point out the necessity of adopting ML-based methods at the same time.
elements.2211.03074_4bc3ca4d3ba1bdbcb46cb526452f8: We first review the background and fundamental methods of adopting DRL to solve combinatorial optimization problems
elements.2211.03074_691859828eadab778cafd7d202466: These methods are mainly based on two categories: Pointer Networks and Graph Neural Networks (GNNs), each of which has different characteristics and applicability
elements.2211.03074_64b99c058f30e936ce3873a4b5089: Here, we mainly introduce the related concepts and methods that will be used in solving the IM problem later
elements.2211.03074_ee0fcfc802c0be3da39abe0e7f0d5: Then, we review the current DRL methods to solve the IM problem, which relies on the techniques of graph embeddings and the DRL framework to solve the combinatorial optimization problems
elements.2211.03074_d441502e6c33f7fec70fe8aa49cba: Finally, we also summarize some ML-based methods from other niche technology stacks to address the IM problem.
elements.2211.03074_d57dee59534647295459eed6ae32b: Based on the IM problem, there are a large number of variants that are adapted to different application scenarios, including the topic-aware IM problem
elements.2211.03074_e3ca6b16076e469010490425d0ed7: Thus, we review the latest ML-based works that are used to solve different kinds of variant IM problems
elements.2211.03074_286aaeea7edaaed7cb7611354b1b1: Finally, we summarize the advantages and research opportunities of adopting ML-based methods to address the IM problem and the variants of IM problem in different social applications.
elements.2211.03074_c4622e0f5eac6ce273a4a7d53d81e: As a special combinatorial optimization problem, the IM problem has inherent complexity and vitality
elements.2211.03074_a09e9efd3a1c375a2a3c70536425c: To the best of our knowledge, we are the first to survey the IM problem from an ML-based combinatorial optimization perspective
elements.2211.03074_998b9fe40a8cbef1fa8e9eb3c9d63: The architecture of this paper is shown in Fig.
elements.2211.03074_a995c2caf1315b47d20afd4cb0a99: It involves a variety of emerging machine learning technologies such as reinforcement learning, graph learning, online learning, etc
elements.2211.03074_7dc216b35a6d0cd997c9ba124ff3e: Compared with traditional algorithms, it has great advantages in time complexity, generalization ability, and real-time performance
elements.2211.03074_01a89977c1a4e38bf4a33b8c855fc: This paper not only overlooks the macro blueprint of this research field from a high-level perspective, but also explains it in detail
elements.2211.03074_b4cfdedfe6ad67a7db9a5df0bf70b: The IM problem has been a hot research topic in the field of network science, social computing, and combinatorial optimization for the past twenty years since Kempe
elements.2211.03074_5ea90af0f577a7fc8ec527ac9246b: first defined the IM problem in 2003

elements.2211.03074_b7c0fb8b1a1df9c55c1363ae7e65c: proposed the technique of reverse influence sampling in 2014

elements.2211.03074_3e35a3e9d579e776ef59c4de7e264: They divided traditional algorithms into three categories: simulation-based, proxy-based, and sampling-based approaches
elements.2211.03074_894e24cfba95dff0274cc77877070: The introduction of traditional algorithms in this paper will continue this classification method and supplement some of the latest works
elements.2211.03074_28a95d52165f625874936db354b1c: After 2018, there have been some new surveys

elements.2211.03074_181f67959fdc3fbd85a55355819b7: They summarized some updated research progress and challenges in this direction

elements.2211.03074_769e4478df673c2dfb7a2cf17ecad: In this paper, we present a comprehensive review on the IM problem by introducing the latest techniques and approaches based on machine learning and give a fine-grained discussion and analysis on these new ML-based methods
elements.2211.03074_c10f3f3863ab69c514bfe710211da: This will be a pioneering and influential work.

elements.2211.03074_c6f05e153725fea465e3ff3f093d5: However, CELF introduces an upper bound attached to each node whose value is its marginal gain in some past iteration
elements.2211.03074_fd70bf6b509c6c1e374dabe08803b: Thus, we do not need to compute the marginal gain if its upper bound is already smaller than the maximum of those visited nodes' marginal gain that have been computed in the current iteration

elements.2211.03074_62ccc55ffe0e578b5c9b07a671687: During the iteration, the nodes out of seed set are traversed in descending order based on their upper bounds to compute the marginal gain
elements.2211.03074_558288dee88c9db08e2bbc2dd4911: Here, it introduces an early stopping mechanism that the traversal within an iteration would be stopped if the maximum upper bound of all unvisited nodes is smaller than at least one marginal gain of the visited nodes
elements.2211.03074_445ea8dcbb7204533a47bfb7383b6: Once the early stopping triggered, the current iteration would be terminated, the upper bound of each visited node would be updated with the latest marginal gains
elements.2211.03074_0eb8a149845167f568c8d7779b5a0: The idea behind is that the marginal gain of a node in the current iteration cannot be larger than its marginal gain in the previous iteration, and hence, maintains it while selecting seeds in subsequent iterations

elements.2211.03074_9612c6abdf23a591fa93011e4d00f: Deep Reinforcement Learning for Combinatorial Optimization
elements.2211.03074_16488fdda27ac92e7407f3a0ac88a: As mentioned in the previous section, there is no traditional algorithm that can perfectly solve the IM problem
elements.2211.03074_e868d9432159c6a84944a26905144: For heuristic algorithms, they have to be designed according to given diffusion models and have no theoretical guarantee
elements.2211.03074_553e33939da99b7748ebb4e0cf171: For approximation algorithms, their scalability has reached the limit and time efficiency cannot be further optimized
elements.2211.03074_8c6c610bd1af4c2716b69e859f7c9: No matter which traditional algorithm we use, it has a poor generalization ability
elements.2211.03074_f5e8e630a343e4f322deba69a717a: That is to say, when the network topology changes, the algorithm must be re-run to keep the validity of the seed set
elements.2211.03074_0ea9b60e12cb3babcd441178fc69f: In recent years, a new technique of solving combinatorial optimization problems by deep reinforcement learning (DRL) has emerged, which can effectively address the drawbacks of traditional algorithms
elements.2211.03074_bba146eeb716368ba2286985f383e: The IM problem is a special kind of combinatorial optimization problems
elements.2211.03074_8b5c6deb332fc0b6f43cf78b3f7d6: Thus, before introducing machine learning (ML) based IM algorithms, we first survey some latest development of DRL for combinatorial optimization
elements.2211.03074_ca3ad51f1a3c6b557d65ccaa82633: We will focus on the concepts, technologies, and methods related to ML-based IM algorithms
elements.2211.03074_754ef5071484268754bf8f626f25c: The Combinatorial Optimization (CO) problem is a sub-field of mathematical optimization problem, which is defined in the discrete space
elements.2211.03074_306a38a339c95f7c0dc8c6d2b103d: The CO problem can be defined by a standard form, which is mathematically formulated as follows:
elements.2211.03074_72836cfd4328ef0bde8239bf7caa6: Typical CO problems include Traveling Salesman Problem (TSP), Vehicle Routing Problem (VRP), Job Scheduling, Knapsack, Minimum Vertex Cover (MVC), Minimum Dominating Problem (MDoP), and so on
elements.2211.03074_aa78ef6c6b75bda8e0ee223e59a76: Similar to traditional algorithms for the IM problem, traditional algorithms for CO problems consist of exact, approximate, and heuristic approaches
elements.2211.03074_37f98321824514e5f93ffd007c913: The exact approach primarily adopts the idea of "divide and conquer", to dividing the problem into smaller sub-problems and solve them recursively to finally achieve the optimal solution, such as Branch-and-Bound
elements.2211.03074_40e9f338abfcfba09e01ac3cc4254: The approximate approach aims at finding local optimal solution for higher efficiency, such as greedy algorithm and local search algorithm, which can provide theoretical guarantees for the quality of solutions
elements.2211.03074_6ddbf2ccf2de02dea507877003cf6: The heuristic algorithm, such as stimulated annealing algorithm
elements.2211.03074_be4dcd82e2722d3913b78d4263fea: , can largely accelerate the computation by using specialized domain knowledge and involving trial-and-error as well as tuning
elements.2211.03074_8c7b8959c3516279a9cf1285bfb96: However, all of these approaches suffer from computational inefficiency for large-scale problems
elements.2211.03074_dd74ab0517f5208af690043799219: In addition, for more and more applications that require high real-time performance, once the situation of problem changes, it is necessary to recalculate the solution, which would inevitably produce too expensive calculation costs
elements.2211.03074_ee2e77e481330f897cc3887425bf9: Thus, we need to find other efficient and effective solutions
elements.2211.03074_f4be4ee0cb52b204c612841a13e82: A natural question is whether a ML-based algorithm can have generalization ability such that the algorithm of a CO problem learned from part of instances can be generalized to unseen instances with the same distribution
elements.2211.03074_7a05fddb8924f278cde14c7af555c: To answer this question, a lot of researchers have made efforts to it
elements.2211.03074_2582367d9e9a7fafcfc1019fe259a: Using ML-based methods to solve CO problems can be traced back to the Hopfield network
elements.2211.03074_f4a7699cd5028c8dbcddc8bef53d3: It can be used to solve the TSP
elements.2211.03074_50ac4069ecb4aec30b81313296df0: but only for those small-scale single instances
elements.2211.03074_21985463f750508afa0c97692390a: With the development of hardware performance and deep learning, a lot of researchers began to study how to use ML-based methods to solve generalized NP-hard CO problems
elements.2211.03074_948baa091cf1b85be3fa4ce80deef: They mainly rely on DRL because it can learn a policy to guide a series of decision making actions under different circumstances in order to gain a maximum accumulated benefit, which aligns with the characteristics of CO problems like TSP, Knapsack, IM, etc
elements.2211.03074_3686338ce50fa53a3df35d2bafad2: According to the coding strategies of problem instances, the architecture can be roughly divided into two categories: one based on Pointer Networks (Ptr-Nets)
elements.2211.03074_c914e7046f77bb7a9cbf500c91a87: and the other based on Graph Neural Networks (GNNs)
elements.2211.03074_9539d6734aa06b99608ae5acd6b76: They form two kinds of end-to-end framework: "Ptr-Nets based RL" and "GNNs based RL"
elements.2211.03074_2c0b1796119af7d088af4fd89fb13: End-to-end framework takes a given problem instance as input, and can directly output the solution without searching

elements.2211.03074_112c2747d584cf585bf82c92d264b: Therefore, it has the advantages of fast solution speed and strong generalization ability

elements.2211.03074_3609efa997cd18ac1ac5a10eab2ba: The variant IM problems combine the vanilla IM problem with diverse traits of practical scenarios and they are of research value for real-life applications
elements.2211.03074_a4c769fcfcc95a41fcea125bf23bd: In this section, we survey the latest applications for the variant IM problems, and focus more on those works adopting ML-based methods
elements.2211.03074_b8ce678f4c7485d5825d5e61fbefe: In fact, these variant IM problems have been defined and studied in the era of traditional algorithms
elements.2211.03074_dee1cf9b15598f7ae977784b89f34: If you want to know more about their definitions and are interested in traditional algorithms for solving variant IM problems, please check Li's survey
elements.2211.03074_445a137b8a3943c10aa92b04c2112: It is very challenging to summarize this part of the work, which mainly involves two difficulties
elements.2211.03074_69f73b88c7a930a1a250ee7d96f64: First, how to classify these variant IM problems; secondly, how to accurately judge whether it belongs to the traditional algorithm or the ML-based algorithm, and summarize its adopted technologies
elements.2211.03074_eb1ae212b48d3ee711283227c7ba1: The taxology and its corresponding representatives are summarized in Table
elements.2211.03074_90cc2b9bc2cd88be46a7eb38524f9: The competitive IM problem assumes multiple parties in a social network compete against each other in propagation of information, e.g. one mobile phone provider would make a suitable marketing policy to maximize the number of its customers when there are other providers giving policies to compete in the same social network

elements.2211.03074_f4d0585867ed4e65e256c49b4a551: ML-Based Algorithms to Solve the CO Problem
elements.2211.03074_df93dea8ebd4096c100c56b0eb2b9: Because the solution quality of a CO problem directly output by deep neural network cannot be compared with that of professional solvers, and the search space is too large, some auxiliary measures are needed to further improve the performance, such as beam search and local search, thus we cannot completely get rid of the dependence on traditional algorithms
elements.2211.03074_371ad3c32a796bd5f19cb64c4109b: It indicates that the current deep models still have a lot of room for improvement
elements.2211.03074_d432c0b5872410e038576e75fe628: Besides, in the training of DRL algorithms, they usually design an end-to-end model which includes graph embedding and RL model
elements.2211.03074_4ba70df2507c81155d8ca631cd490: However, commonly used training algorithms, such as REINFORCE, DQN family, and Actor-Critic, have the defects of low sampling efficiency and slow convergence
elements.2211.03074_252a2168e68d76109a14d02aae026: Thus, how to improve the graph embedding and RL training algorithm according to the actual needs of a specific CO problem is a very important challenge
elements.2211.03074_419b1fb6995e0fd7143c1c7a71560: As we know, the IM problem is a specific CO problem on graphs
elements.2211.03074_989ab8d9988dd42fbf661c9a3f07a: Thus, the main challenges of ML-based CO algorithms also apply to the IM problem
elements.2211.03074_5d6ac1175859d95c5530452424ff1: We summarize them from five different perspectives.
elements.2211.03074_324e6ca8d69a9ea19ae103138cfd1: It refers to the performance when running on large datasets with the same distribution
elements.2211.03074_7f6c01074f72094667ab8bbea24f2: This property is very important for the IM problem because the social network is usually large-scale, including hundreds of millions of users
elements.2211.03074_166cfe955de4a4b22580c18c1b7e0: However, current ML-based algorithms cannot guarantee the quality of the solution when the graph is large
elements.2211.03074_bd85f659b294b836e9ee8c82282d2: Compared to small-scale networks, the quality of the solution decreased obviously.
elements.2211.03074_05a05a14b7e7359f59d1a8cc022c8: It refers to whether the algorithm can adapt to perturbation or adjustment in the problem
elements.2211.03074_5c52e3e8601b942cffaaf16db050d: Back to the IM problem, there are a lot of related variants, for example, change the objective function in a small range, increase or decrease constraints, etc
elements.2211.03074_00c78de06d72beb832d5116eec121: An ML-based framework can perfectly solve the vallina IM problem but cannot effectively adapt to variant IM problems.
elements.2211.03074_d8acc0b56a406387c81bf60e6fe72: It refers to the performance when running on unseen instances, which is the reason why we attempt to use ML-based algorithms to solve the IM problem
elements.2211.03074_d7be90e602e69e5aba82eaae08234: In the IM problem, this can avoid repeating the process of seed set selection when the graph changes dynamically
elements.2211.03074_9f94545bb20d7ef1f7ca1c2419455: Thus, we want to let the ML-based algorithms be trained by using a number of small-scale graphs, and it can work well in large-scale new graphs
elements.2211.03074_7b7a05f18eb3c7ffde3183d417c88: have made efforts to this end, and they improve and validate the generalization ability of DRL algorithm with multi-layer GNNs.
elements.2211.03074_7bdb3d4d71e5eca8fb7a78796acee: It refers to the running time
elements.2211.03074_52ad4eb77efe268a0b73ff5ffbab3: In ML-based algorithms, its running time can be divided into training time and prediction time
elements.2211.03074_e7db2c7584ce8d87da1b3a45a0703: The training time mainly depends on hardware conditions, dataset size, and convergence speed of the algorithm
elements.2211.03074_380b4b800b04cfdaa6edebbfc1dff: As an algorithm designer, its main goal and difficulty lie in optimizing the convergence speed of algorithms, and the convergence speed of existing RL algorithms is also a big challenge, requiring multiple interactions with the environment
elements.2211.03074_c5e795d7a343ec6702778333a95ab: The prediction time is much shorter than the training time, but there is room for further improvement due to the large scale of social networks
elements.2211.03074_adbcc69191c3cf4f75713477b9774: It is the key to whether its algorithm can be applied to real-time environments.
elements.2211.03074_9eaff1058012d50a2d81e9b82b37f: It refers to whether ML-based algorithms can automatically achieve scalability, adaptivity, and generalizability
elements.2211.03074_9266489001144112232eba5ac1abb: For example, it can automatically revise parameters or structures to adapt to the change of network scale, disturbance of problems, and new unknown networks without the need for redesigning algorithms or retraining
elements.2211.03074_1106323f862851c11957b9b2db6fd: This automatic framework not only meets all requirements of real applications, but also has intelligent adaptability to the environment
elements.2211.03074_3e05a2e9d44a6c46f786573bb6511: This is also the ultimate goal of artificial intelligence.
elements.2211.03074_7b5065a49e71f1c51e301a68a1bc2: ML-based algorithms to solve CO problems has developed rapidly in recent years, but they are still in their infancy
elements.2211.03074_09132387cbd6eb1bc27dc29b7d01f: Up to now, we can only deal with some simple and typical CO problems, whose scope of application is far less than the traditional optimization algorithm
elements.2211.03074_45067eef88d51d2c0d3f9c17e4c43: Although the above goals have not been achieved at present: scalability, adaptivity, generalizability, efficiency, and automation, they points out a way for future research
elements.2211.03074_c1087f2c365fbe0d026992f0dab44: Using this research framework to solve the IM problem can effectively alleviate the bottleneck faced by traditional algorithms, but it leads to a lot of new issues needed to be solved.

elements.2211.03074_918e5a70d0b7368f8401fae09c2f8: Perhaps, there have more complex constraints or a higher requirement for real-time and generalization ability

elements.2211.03074_607f7e8879f73dccae470d0f9f09a: According to the above analysis, we can see that there are still many challenges in solving the IM problem in large-scale social networks by using existing ML-based approaches
elements.2211.03074_afec48127a41ee141091cdf112dd8: Up to now, we can only utilize a simple DRL framework to deal with the vanilla IM problem under the IC model in medium-sized social networks, and has great limitations
elements.2211.03074_ae451e10bec38068e3054c0c0b2e3: It is mainly reflected in the fact that it cannot adapt to diversified diffusion models in real applications, the training efficiency based on GNNs is not acceptable, the calculation of reward functions cannot overcome the
elements.2211.03074_a65e464c50942e48d51c3ca7864cf: P-hardness of computing the influence spread, and cannot adjust to more complicated variant problems
elements.2211.03074_a5adc431948443193e908a15b84a3: Because of this, it also brings new research opportunities and vitality to this field
elements.2211.03074_49ea6d63c1321589e7c74e7271fdf: To deal with these challenges, we need to make efforts from the basic theory of machine learning and the modeling of social network applications, and combine them effectively.
elements.2211.03074_a69e688fbf305f03fdbd26798180a: To deal with the IM problem and its variants by using ML-based methods, we need to make efforts in two aspects
elements.2211.03074_0bc163b801eaa201ac6fd57d41e91: One is the basic research of solving combinatorial optimization problems by machine learning, then it tries to design new frameworks or improve the existing ML-based frameworks to enhance scalability, adaptivity, generalizability, efficiency, and automation
elements.2211.03074_f8552bcafa290a0e44cdef6465a66: The GNN-based RL will be the mainstream framework in the future
elements.2211.03074_e5c7cff23ec59cc028befd0774bd6: Compared with supervised learning, it does not need a lot of datasets
elements.2211.03074_1a103853ab777868d23b3a0818b74: It is very difficult to produce a large number of datasets in CO problems
elements.2211.03074_a4e620049f3215b4b56168f1a04ac: In addition to relying on traditional RL, one of the key factors affecting algorithm performance when dealing with graph problems is graph representation, which largely determines scalability and generalizability
elements.2211.03074_748c5f43b10453f0304739de7349e: Here, we should try to combine with the latest deep learning technologies, such as attention mechanism and transformer
elements.2211.03074_f434063eab725a61b294dfd41e5af: Finally, we should emphasize that adopting ML-based methods does not mean completely giving up traditional methods, where some ideas from approximation or heuristic algorithms are still worth learning
elements.2211.03074_47bba97e2ec019129c8d80195ffca: As an instance, using some simple heuristic rules to prune the search space will make the subsequent operation more efficient
elements.2211.03074_8fb920c0a920f40d4409f23436aa1: How to fully combine the two kinds of strategies and complement each other's advantages is also an important development direction in the future
elements.2211.03074_e5b98dbc77befdbdf68ba42636759: The other is how to apply the existing ML-based CO algorithms to solve the IM problem and its variants
elements.2211.03074_6bf9e3d8c00e8e4470b0073e9e889: The IM problem in social networks has its unique characteristics, which leads to the general solution framework for CO problems based on machine learning not fully adapting to it
elements.2211.03074_923d99aa5d9ed96cf37943b47265b: It is mainly embodied in the following three points
elements.2211.03074_798653e3d2687d66175146d624868: First, social networks are very large
elements.2211.03074_2f7409856a8f72d1d7eaef8126c80: This is very demanding of scalability and efficiency
elements.2211.03074_e2dbce193cbf68beac115888bdb91: The quality of the solutions output by the current ML-based CO algorithms on large-scale networks is poor, and the training time of the scheme relying on the graph neural network model is too long, which leads to its applications limiting the network scale
elements.2211.03074_d475cb24f53054c2b2646d1f071df: Second, social applications at present require high generalization ability of algorithms
elements.2211.03074_472486e1851aa43b8851216437ae9: This is due to the dynamic change of network topology caused by the number of users and the dynamic change of friendships among users
elements.2211.03074_82399e7944cfe7221209ee89cbfdf: Third, computing the influence spread is not the valuable oracle
elements.2211.03074_74c5a770a61e81a6ac0734f6c6663: This is because computing the spread is
elements.2211.03074_cb4ed5aea0bd3b8755a849c2e3a12: P-hard under classic diffusion models, which brings great difficulties to the training of ML-based algorithms, and it cannot completely get rid of dependence on traditional search algorithms
elements.2211.03074_81314f55cd5a3a5ebfc889dfe0d86: Fourth, variant IM problems totally inherit the above characteristics, and the objective functions and constraints are more complex
elements.2211.03074_bd54a8794e253fb07af8cd487c4c2: This is very demanding of adaptivity and automation
elements.2211.03074_6f3249d1a26e778fdfa027ed1e226: Therefore, we can seek plenty of innovation and research opportunities based on the above two major aspects
elements.2211.03074_79e3959c90725028c3c3b96801167: Here, we can not only study the basic theory of solving CO problems by adopting ML-based approaches, but also study the transfer of existing theories to the IM problem and its variants
elements.2211.03074_d17a1d8d698f89a4976f0ef6b10b2: Our goal is to construct an ML-based solution framework for the IM problem to meet the practical application requirements, including scalability, adaptivity, generalizability, efficiency, and automation
elements.2211.03074_a54405a6f7ecb62797c69b58c0b9f: Finally, they jointly promote the progress of theory and technology in this field.
elements.2211.03074_1fd1f78ee36cd0a2850bbcb66ce12: In this paper, we present a comprehensive survey on the IM problem from an ML-based combinatorial optimization perspective
elements.2211.03074_df695249e0bb01bfa8d78cae9c0e3: In order to compare ML-based algorithms with traditional approaches, we first summarize three kinds of traditional approaches: simulation-based, proxy-based, and sampling-based approaches, and point out their respective defects
elements.2211.03074_6b2d7f5dabcead613bc89bb7a2f1e: Then, we survey two kinds of commonly used framework that can be used to solve combinatorial optimization problems: Ptr-Nets Based RL framework and GNNs Based RL Framework
elements.2211.03074_3225d78a917d7d578c3b4cd9f05b5: We discuss their basic structures and characteristics in detail, and focus on summarizing the principles and technologies related to the IM problem
elements.2211.03074_318955680ffd1c4635db7356abf3a: This paves the way for solving the IM problem by using ML-based methods
elements.2211.03074_12dc24be0d471323acad1259f6103: Furthermore, we cover almost all the ML-based IM algorithms up to now, focusing on several pioneering DRL solution frameworks, and summarizing the variant IM problems and their corresponding ML-based algorithms
elements.2211.03074_7673cda49a8af26b45932d3e26a7b: Here, we elaborately explain their working principle and how to break through the bottleneck of traditional algorithms
elements.2211.03074_5f4d57b7c98dc0e13329a82acb89a: Finally, we summarize the existing difficulties and future research directions in this field from two aspects
elements.2211.03074_79fe2725891555b6aecbf89486ffb: In summary, machine learning, as a representative of emerging technology, is a hot topic at present
elements.2211.03074_1ca8e9933c854d9f98b9b9318dce3: Its application in solving algorithm problems in social networks has broad application prospects and commercial value, and it is expected to solve the dilemma faced by traditional algorithms
elements.2211.03074_fefa665ae3a0e6e39758d394071b0: Our survey will give relevant researchers a new perspective to look at the IM problem, and can be used as a learning material to understand the latest ML-based development and research trends in the field of social network and algorithm design, thus laying a good start for the research in this field.
